did.unittitle: Helen A. C. Long and May Chadwick Collection of Hamilton Manufacturing Graphics, 1882-1899
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor- Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Maps and isometric drawings of Hamilton Manufacturing Company.

bioghist.p: The Hamilton Manufacturing Company was a manufacturer of cotton textiles, founded in Lowell, Massachusetts, in 1824.

scopecontent.p: Three sets of four images each. One drawing of the footprints of the Hamilton Manufacturing Company buildings, one map of the buildings and surrounding streets, and two isometric etchings of the buildings.

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

did.unittitle: Maps of the Hamilton Manufacturing Company
Item 1: Hamilton Manufacturing Co., Lowell, Mass., 1882 (drawing?)

scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [after 1900]. Image depicts a drawing of the Hamilton Manufacturing Company in Lowell, Mass., showing the buildings along the canal. Buildings in background very lightly drawn in. A larger size of this image is reproduced in "City of Lowell, Mass.: Its Commercial and Financial Resources. Souvenir of the Lowell Morning Mail. [Lowell, Mass.]: Wm. Fisk, 1890" (F74.L93L69 1890). Bound with three other items. Copy A. 17.5 x 11.75 cm.
Format: Etching.

did.unittitle: Item 2: Hamilton Manufacturing Co., Lowell, Mass., 1893 insurance map

scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [after 1900]. Image depicts an insurance survey done of the Hamilton Manufacturing Company in Lowell, Mass., November 13, 1893. Map shows the buildings and layout of the company. Bound with three other items. Copy A. 11.25 x 17.5 cm.
Format: Map.

did.unittitle: Item 3: Hamilton Manufacturing Co., Lowell, Mass., 1893 insurance map (isometric view)

scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [after 1900]. Image depicts an insurance survey done of the Hamilton Manufacturing Company in Lowell, Mass., November 13, 1893. Map shows an isometric view, as if drawn from above, showing the buildings and layout of the company. Bound with three other items. Copy A. 17 x 11.5 cm.
Format: Etching.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Hamilton Manufacturing Co., Lowell, Mass., 1893 insurance map

scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [after 1900]. Image depicts an insurance survey done of the Hamilton Manufacturing Company in Lowell, Mass., November 13, 1893. Map shows the buildings and layout of the company. Bound with three other items. Copy B. 11.25 x 17 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Plan of Hamilton Manufacturing Co., Lowell, Mass., 1899

scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [after 1900]. Image depicts a plan of the Hamilton Manufacturing Company in Lowell, Mass., dated March 14, 1899, as suggested by O. H. M. (Oliver H. Moulton). Moulton was the superintendent of the Hamilton Mfg. Co. at this time. It is unclear if this was a proposed new building plan. Bound with three other items. Copy A. 17.5 x 11.75 cm.
Format: Map.
